definition: unspoken dialogue in a play, left for the audience to infer/subtext/(fig.) implicit assertion
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Create a scene or an event that sets the groundwork for subtextual meaning.
sentences.chinese: 创造一个场景或事件为潜台词打好基础。

sentences.english: The subtext of her book is that sexual self-revelation is groundbreaking in itself.
sentences.chinese: 作品的潜台词是性流露是一种自我突破。

sentences.english: The subtext is that much tougher regulation is required.
sentences.chinese: 这句话的潜台词是，更加强硬的调控是必须的。

sentences.english: I know the subtext of his remark.
sentences.chinese: 我明白他话里的潜台词。

sentences.english: The frustration of not knowing is the subtext of a lot of what happens in Fukushima these days.
sentences.chinese: 沮丧的“不知道”是这些天来蔓延于福岛的潜台词。

sentences.english: It was an honest response, and also something of an understatement.
sentences.chinese: 这是个诚恳的回答，当然也有一些潜台词。

sentences.english: Shop Office according to the subtext is to tax.
sentences.chinese: 网店办照的潜台词是要征税。

sentences.english: These doubts are brought to the surface, but are within the subtext of the scene.
sentences.chinese: 这些疑虑并未表现在表面，而是藏在场景的潜台词中。

definition: unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
idea/opinion/meaning/wish/desire/interest/fun/token of appreciation, affection etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to give as a small token/to do sth as a gesture of goodwill etc
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the classics)/perfunctory/to skimp/to botch/to do sth half-heartedly or just for show/barely enough to get by
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
